Current TODOS from discussing with Jun offline:

1. Filed https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/KAFKA-4970 as a future improvement. 
2. Need to remove the `Log.updateIdMap` which removes entries before the current dirty offset from the pid map. this is a bug which would result in real entries being lost. 
3. Need to name the snapshot files appropriately. Currently they are in the partition directory, but have the topic partition in their name, which is redundant. 
4. Need to ensure that `ProducerIdMapping.maybeTakeSnapshot` is called periodically.
The test is ignored in https://jenkins.confluent.io/job/system-test-kafka-branch-builder-2/235/console, merging to trunk.
@benstopford, I merged a PR that disables the test_zk_security_upgrade test until this PR lands. When you rebase, can you please remove the ignore annotation from that test? Thanks.
How does it help to merge these methods with empty implementations? It seems like anyone can just include that in the branch that they're working on?

@guozhangwang @ijuma @hachikuji - this is for KIP-134, so is a WiP. I'd like to get your feedback on this early as.
1. my scala is pretty bad
2. this is an area of not looked at before, so I'm likely completely missing something.
3. You probably have better ideas.
4. it is always good to get early feedback.

Thanks

Test PASSed (JDK 8 and Scala 2.11).

There is transient failure with this test because the response is available almost immediately when user tries to get it. The broker is able to respond immediately without waiting for the logStartOffset to be propagated to the followers because the offset in this DeleteRecordsRequest (i.e. 5L) is already the logStartOffset of the follower.

We can likely fix this error by increasing the offset in this DeleteRecordsRequest from 5L to 8L so that the leader broker has to wait at least one roundtrip time for follower to acknowledge the new logStartOffet before it can respond to client. But we will have to remove this line in the test if there is still transient failure after this fix.
@ijuma @becketqin Thanks for filing the ticket. Can you review the patch?
